summary: Between 2023 and 2024, theS&P 500 generated total returns of 58% and 87% . Amazon, Microsoft, Alphabet, and Meta Platforms all confirmed their plans for massive AI infrastructure spending . Advanced Micro Devices also shared encouraging details regarding the outlook for its next-generation GPUs .  Nvidia could see its shares surge after it reports its first-quarter results on May 28 . Investors ought to pay close attention toMicrosoft,Amazon,Alphabet,Meta Platforms, andAdvanced Micro Devices .  These three "Magnificent Seven" members are on track to spend a combined $260 billion on AI capex this year . AMD, Meta Platforms and AMD are also spending big on AI-powered wearable hardware .  The graph below illustrates Nvidia's stock price over the last three years . Nvidia stock has risen considerably across this period -- but we already knew that . Since Nvidia reported its Q2 2024 earnings in August, the stock has actually dropped by about 9%.  Analysts' consensus estimates are for Nvidia's revenue and earnings to nearly double over the next two years . Su's remarks underscore this idea, as she expects production of AMD's next-generation chip architecture to begin scaling up in the latter portion of the year .  Nvidia remains well positioned to dominate the AI infrastructure market over the coming years . For these reasons, I think Nvidia stock will soar following its earnings report later this month . I see the stock as a no-brainer buying opportunity right now .  John Mackey, former CEO of Whole Foods Market, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors . Randi Zuckerberg is a former director of market development and spokeswoman for Facebook .  This article was originally published by The Motley Fool . Share your knowledge of how to invest in a company that makes $1,000,000 a year . For more information on investing in U.S. stocks, visit www.thefool.com/tips for more information .

Google will be committing early-stage development capital in exchange for the option to purchase the power once the sites are complete . The deal is the latest in a long string of tech companies partnering with nuclear power companies to fuel growth .  Elementl Power was founded in 2022 as a nuclear power project developer . Google has agreed to commit early-stage development capital to advance the projects . The tech company will have the option to buy the power once the sites are complete and operational .  Each project is aiming for at least 600 MW of capacity . The number is in line with Elementl Power's overall goal of adding 10 GW of power to the nuclear grid by 2035 .  O'Leary called Missing Ring his biggest mistake — Don't repeat history—Invest in RYSE at just $1.90/share . The need for new power sources to support data centers has been a concern among tech giants for some time .  Pre-IPO shares will be sold for just $0.30/share . The company is expected to go public on Thursday . The IPO will be the first major U.S. tech firm to make a public offering in the next few months .

At least one Apple executive expects AI-powered alternatives to Google's search engine will eventually be offered to users of Apple's web browser . Shares of parent company Alphabet fell 8% on Wednesday after this possibility was revealed . Interested investors worried about Apple's growing interest in AI competition might want to use this setback as an opportunity to buy Alphabet stock .  Apple's services chief Eddy Cue commented on Wednesday that he believes artificial intelligence-powered web search tools like OpenAI or Perplexity will eventually be added to the list of search engines made available to users of Apple's proprietary web browser, Safari . No likely time frames were given, nor were any guarantees made .  Apple is considering introducing alternative search tools or removing Google as Safari's default search engine . Google currently handles 90% of the world's web queries, according to StatCounter . According to online advertising research outfit Chitika, 97% of iPhone users use Google's search engine on their phones .  Google's Gmail alone boasts over 2.5 billion worldwide users . TV ratings outfitNielsens says Google's YouTube is the U.S. single-most-visited streaming video platform .  Safari users' usage of Google's AI-powered search engine is limited . It's going to take a long time to sever Safari users from using Google's other services . The prospect isn't nearly as catastrophic as some are fearing it may be, though .  Alphabet's search business might be dented by the advent of other AI-powered search options . It won't be major or permanent damage, though. If you liked Alphabet before Wednesday, there's still just as much to like now .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is 907% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to163% for the S&P 500 . Apple's Siri-powered search engine could be the next generation of the tech giant's search engines .

At Alphabet's current share price, a stock split is unlikely . The tech company is going through legal troubles and is reliant on online advertising revenue . Alphabet could be poised for future growth with its investments in AI and other emerging technologies .  Alphabet conducted a 20-for-1 stock split on July 15, 2022, meaning investors received 20 shares for every one share they owned . Before the split, Alphabet was trading at $2,255 . Afterward, it traded at a split-adjusted price of about $113, making it a far more budget-friendly investment .  Alphabet made $90.2 billion in revenue in the first quarter, a 12% increase year over year . Alphabet owns YouTube, which captured 12% of overall TV viewing, according to Nielsen data . Android is the leading mobile operating system, with a 72% market share .  Last year, a federal judge ruled that Google had built illegal monopoly power with its online search business . A penalty hasn't been decided yet, but the U.S. Department of Justice wants Alphabet to sell its Chrome browser and its advertising business . The legal process will likely drag on until next year, so Alphabet is in an uncertain position .  The odds of Alphabet beating the market over the next five years are much higher . The tech giant has a nice mix of market-leading products and exciting innovations . The company has $74.9 billion in free cash flow over the trailing 12 months .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is 907% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to163% for the S&P 500 . The long-term investing thesis for Amazon remains as strong as it was when the stock was hitting all-time highs . Google parent Alphabet faces big challenges, but it should also continue to be a big winner . The Trade Desk is still the leader in a market with huge growth potential .  Amazon's shares are 22% below the high from earlier this year at the time of this writing . This sell-off is due to concerns about the negative impacts oftariffs . I suspect Amazon's business could hold up better than many expect . Exorbitant tariff levels will almost certainly be temporary .  Amazon remains as solid as it was when its share price was hitting all-time highs just a few months ago . E-commerce still has a lot of room to expand. Organizations will continue shifting their IT spending to the cloud. Artificial intelligence (AI) will remain a massive tailwind. Amazon is poised to benefit from all these trends .  The antitrust rulings could cause major headaches for Google . But I wouldn't get the cart before the horse: Alphabet just might come out in better shape than expected . Betting against Google in search or AI is ill-advised in my view .  The Trade Desk's share price has cratered this year . The adtech stock is down almost 60% from its record high hit in the fourth quarter of 2024 . But don't play a funeral dirge for this one-time highflier . I think the Trade Desk could be like the mythical phoenix rising from the ashes .  This adtech stock's crisis presents a great opportunity for long-term investors . If my answers to these questions are right, buying The Trade Desk now should pay off handsomely over the coming years . Google will pay $1.4 billion to Texas to settle a lawsuit claiming the company collected users' datawithout permission . Attorney General Ken Paxton said the settlement sends a message to tech companies that he will not allow them to profit off "selling away our rights and freedoms"  The state argued Google was unlawfully tracking and collecting users’ private data . Paxton claimed the tech giant collected millions of biometric identifiers, including voiceprints and records of face geometry, through applications like Google Photos and Google Assistant . Google said the settlement does not require any additional product changes .  Meta agreed to a $1.4 billion settlement with Texas over claims that Facebook used facial recognition software without users' consent . The "tag suggestions" feature was specifically cited in the suit .
